website_summaries.verdict: Performance improvements raise the G7 X Mark II's grade to excellent, as long as you're not looking for a lot of frills.
pros: The Canon PowerShot G7 X II is nicely designed with good photo quality for its class, and improves noticeably over the earlier model
cons: Still lags behind the competition with respect to features and some aspects of performance

customer_reviews.title: This camera is amazing for its size.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. I'm a professional photographer and I am extremely impressed with the picture quality. I also love all the manual controls and the ease-of-use. I shoot weddings on a Canon 5D Mark III and a Canon 6D. In a pinch I could easily use this camera if I needed to. The picture I have attached is a 15 second exposure with my kids running around with solar lights. This shot is un-edited and was shot in raw. The only thing I did with the picture was transfer it via Wi-Fi to my cell phone using the Canon picture app.
customer_reviews.author: Uriah Werner

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy This Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was such a let down, and I’m legitimately mystified by how high of a rating it has. The camera has a hard time producing crystal focused images in anything other than bright light or with flash, whether using manual of auto settings. The color rendition was mediocre. And worst of all, the automatic lens cover started to glitch after first day of use, needing a push to fully open or close. Didn’t feel like I took a single worthwhile image with this camera. I was really excited to add something this compact and powerful to my collection. I’ll have to keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: Bought brand new. Only worked 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera in May, it stopped working in July. Neither Canon nor Amazon customer service were helpful in getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Wykntia

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy a Canon product if you're planning to travel extensively
customer_reviews.text: 6 months old and lightly used, and either the battery has failed or the camera has developed a fault that prevents the battery from charging. Canon USA's response is useless, only interested in helping once I'm back in the USA. Don't know why I thought they'd be more helpful.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: The Display Screen is bright
customer_reviews.text: Pros: * Can see screen with sunglasses on * Can spot focus in Auto mode by touching screen Cons: * Auto mode only seems to take good photos if there is really good lighting * Photos are grainy (noisy) if it is not sunny * Auto mode seems to overexpose most photos (brightness is too bright) so you have to use shutter priority or aperture priority mode * Difficult to press "Record Video" button making videos shaky * Optical Zoom is only 4X The Sony RX100 VII camera seems to focus better in Auto mode when touching the screen then the Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for non-professional photographers
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a personal camera to capture my family's moments (photo and video) and this is perfect. The picture quality is great and the sound is clear. I purchased this camera after watching multiple YouTube reviews on it, and I'm glad I made the decision to go with this one. It's a bit costly, but I would say relative to other professional cameras its a fair price. My favorite feature is the tilted screen, it's great if you want to record yourself and see what the camera is capturing. Would recommend. Disclaimer: I am not a professional in the slightest, just wanted a nice personal camera.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit for Travel
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something small to carry on trips instead of my DSLR. Very impressed with picture quality, especially indoors with the large sensor. Would have preferred a deeper zoom but also understand that picture quality would have been compromised (and it has a deeper zoom than the Sony comparable model). Complaints I've read about focus issues seem to be folks who need to learn more about aperture and depth of field. Chose this over the Lumix comparable model after reading numerous complaints about lens freeze-ups from the tiniest bit of dust.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Step up from your iPhone
customer_reviews.text: I love a LOT of things about this camera, however the autofocus isn't as great as I was hoping. It sometimes struggles to focus at all and I ahem to turn it off and on and then it works again. Not sure what the deal is there. I also wish there was more depth of field, but I knew that when buying it. Also, cannot attach an external mic so that is a negative. If you're just looking to do simple video/vlogging on something that is a step up from your iPhone, this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first camera with a 1" sensor and I have to say...it's great! Image quality is good even at higher ISO sensitivities, making even ISO 1600 shots usable in some situations. 20MP resolution is more than enough for my needs, if not overkill, but I appreciate the detail and sharpness of the images. The 24-100mm equivalent range isn't terribly "zoomy", but it works well for street photography or for indoor events. Shooting wide open at F1.8 in certain lighting conditions can produce some noticeable chromatic aberration (purple fringing), but that's easily removed in post. Overall, great camera with few flaws.
customer_reviews.author: mLo68

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed

The WiFi capabilities are super quick and work perfectly with the app, and it takes amazing photos in darkness which is awesome. The autofocus is incredible and I can use it for so many different things. The flip-up screen makes it ideal for making youtube videos or taking selfies, too.

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot Digital Camera [G7 X Mark II] with Wi-Fi & NFC, LCD Screen, and 1-inch Sensor - Black, 100 - 1066C001
product_meta.description: Style:Camera Only| Configuration:BaseStay inspired with the PowerShot G7 X Mark II camera, which combines exhilarating speed and performance with a smart, compact design. It can be ideal for travel, events and anywhere on the go, or as a secondary camera, and features a high-performance 1.0-inch 20.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor as well as a bright f/1.8–2.8 lens to help capture impressive images whenever your creativity sparks, even in low light conditions. The DIGIC 7 Image Processor immediately pays dividends with improved auto focus tracking, enhanced IS and superb image clarity even when shooting with a high ISO. For increased flexibility, the PowerShot G7 X Mark II offers high-speed continuous shooting up to 8 fps in RAW, JPEG and RAW+JPEG modes, and is equipped with Full HD capability, built-in Wi-Fi and NFC and in-camera RAW conversion, giving you everything you need to capture inspiring images and video and share them with ease.
feature_bullets: The advanced video capabilities of the Power Shot G7 X Mark II camera can capture moments in the quality they deserve

Features a large 1.0 inch, 20.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor that helps capture high quality images and videos with a wide dynamic range. Autofocus system features ttl autofocus and manual focus. Operating temperature is 0 to 40 degree celsius. Note charging time varies considerably depending on the remaining battery power
An aperture value of f/1.8 at the wide angle and f/2.8 when fully zoomed to a factor of 4.2x (24 100 millimeter), this lens equipped to capture a variety of situations with precision
High resolution, 3.0 inches LCD monitor that tilts up 180 degrees and down 45 degrees is ideal for self portraits and capturing pictures at high and low angles with ease
Built in Wi Fi for on the go convenience and the ability to easily post your images to select social networking and media sites
With the ability to shoot continuously at up to 8 fps, it can help you capture incredible images with nearly no time wasted
